thread.title: BMC polls: BJP leader Shaina NC’s name missing from the voter list, authorities solve the problem
thread.title_full: BMC polls: BJP leader Shaina NC’s name missing from the voter list, authorities solve the problem

author: FE Online
title: BMC polls: BJP leader Shaina NC’s name missing from the voter list, authorities solve the problem
text:
BMC polls: BJP leader Shaina NC’s name missing from the voter list, authorities solve the problem BMC polls: BJP leader Shaina NC’s name missing from the voter list, authorities solve the problem Shaina NC not allowed to cast vote in the 2017 Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls as her name was missing from the voter list. By: FE Online | Published: February 21, 2017 12:56 PM The authorities later looked into the matter and helped her complete the formalities after which Shaina was able to cast the vote. 
Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) leader Shaina NC on Tuesday was initially not allowed to vote in the BMC polls as her name was missing from the voter list. However, the authorities then looked into the matter and helped her complete the formalities after which she was able to cast the vote. Earlier, Shaina NC not allowed to cast vote in the 2017 Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls as her name was missing from the voter list. Shaina, who came to cast her vote on a bicycle, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s picture surmounted at the front, at Napansea Road polling booth here, however, urged the people to exercise their right for the betterment of city. “We have been cycling all over Mumbai and the idea is to get maximum people to come out and vote, to realise that today is not a holiday, but, a day when one has to vote for a better India and a better Mumbai particularly,” Shaina told ANI. 
“We have been cycling all over Mumbai and the idea is to get maximum people to come out and vote, to realise that today is not a holiday, but, a day when one has to vote for a better India and a better Mumbai particularly,” Shaina told ANI. She further said that it was important to be a legitimate part of democracy, which can only happen when everyone votes and exercises their franchise.The local body polls are set to witness a high pitch battle between the BJP, the Shiv Sena, the Congress , the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP). 
Notably, the Shiv Sena and the BJP, its ally at the Centre as well as at the Maharashtra Government, will be facing off after the former decided to part ways for the civic polls. Many big names like NCP Chief Sharad Pawar, Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray and MNS Chief voted in their respective constituencies. Union Minister Prakash Javadekar and Nitin Gadkari also voted in Pune and Nagpur respectively. 
Also Watch: 
Many Bollywood celebrities like Ranveer Singh, Shraddha Kapoor and John Abraham also used their right to vote. “I request people of Maharashtra to use their right to vote. It is your duty and if you won’t invest your time in it, democracy will never improve. So, take out some time from your schedule and please vote today,” said Devendra Fadnavis, Chief Minister, Maharashtra. 
(With inputs from agency)
